On 20 December 2011 05:13, Wesley Tansey <tansey@...> wrote:
>
> Just following up here. It looks like disabling complexity regulation did
> eliminate the dip in fitness (thanks Colin!). Seems odd that it would have
> this affect. Maybe it's a bug?

There was quite a nasty bug (fixed in SVN on August 1st, revision 34)
whereby connection gene objects were being shared between genomes,
hence a mutation of that connection on one genome would affect other
genomes. This is one mechanism by which the best fitness could get
erroneously reduced. The pruning phase I think increases the mutation
rate, hence this bug could be the underlying cause of your problem. If
you're not using version 2.1 then I'd encourage you to look through
the SVN submission history to check if there are other fixes and mods
that may affect your work.


> As far the elitism issue, it's some weird property of having a lot of
> individuals with 0 fitness.

Thanks for the feedback. Will consider your points and look into it.


Colin.
